snippet: Some say the number of Mormons in sci-fi, fantasy and children’s fiction reflect teachings about optimism and a lack of comfort taking up topics like sex.
abstract: Mark Oppenheimer Beliefs column observes that large number of Mormon authors tend to cluster in genre fiction, like sci-fi, fantasy and children's and young adult literature; some say this is due to fact that Mormon culture prefers the sunny and optimistic, and that many members are uncomfortable writing about adult topics like sex and drinking.
lead_paragraph: Some say the number of Mormons in sci-fi, fantasy and children’s fiction reflect teachings about optimism and a lack of comfort taking up topics like sex.
